explanation: a model or other object that represents someone, especially one of a hated person that is hanged or burned in a public place
sentence: Crowds marched through the streets carrying burning effigies of the president.
sentence_gap: Crowds marched through the streets carrying burning ________ of the president.

explanation: to try very hard to persuade someone to do something
sentence: We would spend every meal time entreating the child to eat her vegetables.
sentence_gap: We would spend every meal time __________ the child to eat her vegetables.

explanation: a man belonging to one of several Roman Catholic religious groups, whose members often promise to stay poor
sentence: A brother Robert, the friar, was a Vermont citizen.
sentence_gap: A brother Robert, the _____, was a Vermont citizen.

sentence: New witnesses have cast doubt on some of the evidence that sent the 19-year-old to the gallows.
sentence_gap: New witnesses have cast doubt on some of the evidence that sent the 19-year-old to the _______.

sentence: Antibodies from the mother's milk line the baby's intestines and prevent infection.
sentence_gap: Antibodies from the mother's milk line the baby's __________ and prevent infection.

explanation: an arm or leg of a person or animal
sentence: The accident victims mostly had injuries to their lower limbs.
sentence_gap: The accident victims mostly had injuries to their lower _____.

sentence: At night, the dark streets become menacing.
sentence_gap: At night, the dark streets become ________.

explanation: to live or exist, or to stay energetic and determined, longer than another person or thing
sentence: The empress outlasted all her children.

explanation: formal; a wide range or collection of different things
sentence: There is a whole panoply of remedies and drugs available to the modern doctor.
sentence_gap: There is a whole _______ of remedies and drugs available to the modern doctor.

explanation: lying with the face down and arms stretched out, especially as a sign of respect or worship
sentence: She lay there prostrate, exhausted after a long day's work.
sentence_gap: She lay there _________, exhausted after a long day's work.

explanation: a good understanding of someone and an ability to communicate well with them
sentence: She has an excellent rapport with her staff.
sentence_gap: She has an excellent _______ with her staff.

sentence: He is a millionaire recluse who refuses to give interviews.
sentence_gap: He is a millionaire _______ who refuses to give interviews.

sentence: Of the crops tested, oat and rye grass yielded much more, on average, than the other crops.
sentence_gap: Of the crops tested, oat and ___ grass yielded much more, on average, than the other crops.

sentence: Office supplies - staplers, paper clips and little things like that - are very hard to come by.
sentence_gap: Office supplies - ________, paper clips and little things like that - are very hard to come by.

explanation: a willingness to do what other people want, or the act of considering your wishes as less important than those of other people
sentence: She lives in total subservience to the men in her family.
sentence_gap: She lives in total ____________ to the men in her family.
